liquid noun
(SUBSTANCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] a substance, such as water, that is not solid or a gas and that can be poured easily: Mercury is a liquid at room temperature.

liquid noun
(SOUND)
[ C ]
  phonetics
  specialized (also liquid consonant) a consonant sound in which the tongue partly closes the mouth so that a sound similar to a vowel is made, for example l and r in English: Swift claimed that vowels and liquids were more typical of female speech. Japanese has only one liquid consonant.
